pullRequest.body:
- multiplicativise `contMDiff_of_support`, `contMDiffWithinAt_of_not_mem` and `contMDiffAt_of_not_mem` and use to_additive
- golf `extend_one` with the multiplicative version
- generalise these lemmas to manifolds with zero/one
- slight clean-up: remove unused variables and `open`s
- slight drive-by golfing of one proof
- deprecate `eventuallyEq_zero_nhds` in favor of `not_mem_tsupport_iff_eventuallyEq`

Addresses the post-merge review comments in #9669.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Just pushed an update addressing your changes. Now, `to_additive` fails in one more place, with the same error message.
May I push directly to fix what I can?
Sure, thanks for the offer!

I pushed a fix. The issue was that `to_additive` doesn't guess names, so it had no way to guess `eventuallyEq_one_nhds` was connected to `eventuallyEq_zero_nhds`. You can fix that using `@[to_additive existing foo]`, but I just used [not_mem_mulTSupport_iff_eventuallyEq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Support.html#not_mem_mulTSupport_iff_eventuallyEq) instead. Speaking of that, I think we should just remove `eventuallyEq_zero_nhds`, the statement with `tsupport` is better. On the other hand I like the shorter name, but I can't convince myself that it's worth keeping, so I'll ~~remove~~ deprecate it.
I've done everything I wanted, you can check that you're happy with it and ask another maintainer for a final review.

@ADedecker Thanks for the fixes and further golf; looks good to me.
I just pushed a comment replacing the two remaining uses of the deprecated lemma, so the build should be fixed now.
@maintainer Can somebody take a final look, please?

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thank you for the review, both of you!
bors r+
Canceled.
@grunweg FYI you can do `bors r+` again yourself
bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7545674896/job/20541830409)
Canceled.

The build issue was due to [Function.left_id](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Init/Function.html#Function.left_id) being deprecated recently in favor of [Function.id_comp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Init/Function.html#Function.id_comp). I merged master and fixed it.

Merged with master; the current bors batch *should* not conflict. (`MFDeriv` imports this file, hence its split should not affect this one.)
bors r+
@ADedecker Thank you!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7548226808/job/20549853266)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7548226808/job/20549853081)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7548226808/job/20549853493)

bors d+
Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

Could you do the multiplicative version of this while you're at it? 
EDIT: I didn't see you asked about it in the PR description. The way to have a docstring on the additivized version is `@[to_additive "docstring"]`.

Independently, I thought of the same (and found out about to_additive, luckily), just pushed..
One helper lemma needs a better home, and to_additive fails for some reason I don't understand yet.
I think you could golf it even further by using the multiplicative version of `contMDiff_of_support` I suggested.

```suggestion
/-- `f` is continuously differentiable if it is cont. differentiable at 
each `x ∈ mulTSupport f`. -/
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion /-- `f` is continuously differentiable if it is cont. differentiable at ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(ContMDiff/Basic): multiplicativise, generalise and golf contMDiff_of_support and friends
